thread.title: Self-help guru must pay Microsoft, AT&T attorneys' fees for patent dispute – Fed. Circ.

author: Barbara Grzincic
title: Self-help guru must pay Microsoft, AT&T attorneys' fees for patent dispute – Fed. Circ.

organizations.name: u.s. court of appeals for the federal circuit

text:
April 19, 2018 / 12:27 AM / Updated 15 hours ago Self-help guru must pay Microsoft, AT&T attorneys' fees for patent dispute – Fed. Circ. Barbara Grzincic 1 Min Read 
The legal woes of self-help guru and accused sex-trafficker Keith Raniere mounted on Wednesday as the federal court in charge of patent appeals held that he must pay AT&T and Microsoft nearly $450,000 for attorneys’ fees and costs they incurred after Raniere accused them of infringing several teleconferencing patents that he could not prove he owned. 
A unanimous three-judge panel of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit affirmed a ruling by a federal judge in Dallas who dismissed the case in 2016 and granted attorneys’ fees as a sanction for Raniere’s “pattern of obfuscation and bad faith” in bringing and maintaining the action. 
To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2HeUCnb
